page.title: 13Religion: Churches
page.content: The ecclesiastical parish of Cumnor is a large one and includes Farmoor, Dean Court and trhe Western side of Cumnor Hill. The parish church is St.Michael's in Cumnor village, an ancient building dating from Saxon times. Normal Church of England services are held here. There are two, daughter churches, St.Mary's, Farmoor and St.Andrew's Dean Court, both built when these places were developed residentially between the two World wars. The three churches are staffed by a Vicar, a Deaconess, a non-stipendiary Assistant and two Lay Readers. Cumnor United Reformed Church in Cumnor village has Sunday services. There is a resident Minister. Roman Catholics are served by Hinksey Catholic Parish which has two churches outside the area.
